transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: We have fallen into the rabbit hole as the details of Michael Jackson`s death becomes curiouser and curiouser. Tonight, its new and bizarre autopsy details like the fact that he weighed a mere 136 pounds, he was nearly bald and the tip of his nose was missing. Back with me is Judge Jeanine Pirro. Ok, so what about that he was so isolated this guy that nobody noticed that the nose was missing, that there was -- 136 pounds. You know I found out today he was very tall I didn`t realize that.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: I never saw him in person.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: And you know what`s amazing, I`ve seen him in person. What`s amazing to me is that the guy was able to get off and dance. I mean, if you saw, you know the rehearsals.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: He was able to function and you know, here`s a guy who apparently had you know, the tattoos and by the way, we found out Joy, for the first time that he really did have a skin pigment disease.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: A number of people laughed that off -

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: We used to make fun of him, yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes, it was real, he had that disease.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Right.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: But at the end of the day which ever, the guy was falling apart and then you`ve got this doctors coming in and pricking him with needles --

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: -- and picking his pockets, it`s a disaster what happened to this guy.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Well, he`s been charged with involuntary manslaughter.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Right, right.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Which means there was no intent to hurt, right.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Well, there was no malice.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: No malice.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: But that his reckless and his negligence was so great that he violated every rule of medicine. I mean, think about it, can you imagine going into the operating room and they don`t have resuscitation equipment for you.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes that pretty

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Then don`t have precision dosing, they don`t have you know monitoring, I mean, this guy was out of control.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: But it`s beyond malpractice, right? It`s really beyond malpractice.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: I know and that`s why they are bringing it in criminal

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: This is the intersection between criminal justice and the practice of medicine which is really about doctors who care more about money. This guy made $150,000 a month.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: I know, I know.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Than they care about the Hippocratic Oath that they took

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Right.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: I mean, shame on him.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: $150,000, I mean, HMOs don`t pay that.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Oh now they don`t, they don`t and that`s why they get these concierge doctors. And then the amazing thing --

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Concierge (ph) doctor, I like that.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: The amazing thing is after he died, he said, "By the way you owe me $300,000, you owe me for two months." Are you kidding you`ve killed the guy.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Wow, that`s nervy.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: But all of these little details that are coming out about his weight and the nose and all this.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes that`s sad.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: That`s going to make it look worst for Dr. Murray.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes for Murray it does.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes that`s not good.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: I though you`re going to say for Michael. Yes --

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: No, for -- no Michael is dead.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes he was preying. It`s like a vulture, preying on his victim. I mean, he was pricking this guy full of needles. He should have been giving him food so that he`d gained some weight.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: He should have been trying to heal him. He was addicted to all kinds of prescription drugs.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Right.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: What was he doing and giving Propofol, can you imagine every night saying, "Honey, you know I need to sleep tonight can you give something that they give me in the hospital room, in the operating room." You have it at home without resuscitation equipment?

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Several of my husbands have heard me say that.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Oh they tried to use.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Well, you know before we go. Let`s just talk something lighter for a second.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Ok.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Well, I don`t know if it`s lighter. But you know Elin Woods is going back to Tiger. What do you make of that?

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: I think she`s an amazing woman.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: You do?

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: I think that this woman is thumbing her nose at the rest of the society. And I`m going to give her the benefit of the doubt based upon what her friends are saying.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: That`s it`s not for the money because you know, she had a pre- nup and she only gets so much. I think here`s a woman who says, you know what, I caught him, he`s apparently devastated; crying, depressed and went into rehab.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Look, I`ve got a life, I`ve got a marriage, I have two kids. It`s none of your business if I want to work it out with him and by the way I`ll kill him if I ever catch him texting Rachel Uchitel, or Uchitel or whatever.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes, yes. Who has a job on "Extra" by the way.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: She does?

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: She has a job, yes. And Ashley Dupree has a job with the "Post".

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: So what are we doing?

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: I don`t know we just, we act -- we`re good girls and we get these jobs.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes it`s not right.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: But you know everybody is working, it`s one big happy family.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes but we could have been this to 20 like the rest of us.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: That`s true. Yes I was too busy being depressed. But anyway, what about the fact that --

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: You were never depressed.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: I was for a minute, post partum remorse. I have post partum depression --

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes, right we are all. Yes I had a couple -- did you take it out on the kids or are they all right?

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: No, of course not, you know, what am I, Sylvia Platt (ph)? But here`s the thing.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Right.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: The other story and quickly before we go is Rielle Hunter and Edwards now they`re saying -- the "Enquirer" is saying that he proposed marriage to her.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Let me tell you something.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: He`s denying it but the "Enquirer" has been right.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Oh he denied he dated her and that it wasn`t his baby. Let me tell you something --

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: David Pecker (ph) and the "Enquirer" no more than the FBI, I`m convinced of this.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: David Pecker what a great name.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: Yes, he`s one of the great -- he`s a great guy by the way.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: And I totally believe in them getting married. I do, I do.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: Ok honey.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: They probably will.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: All right Jeanine, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Pirro
transcript.text: It`s good to see you.

transcript.speaker: Behar
transcript.text: And you`ll be back with us in -- a little later. Yes you will. More on the latest shocker from the John Edwards scandal. That`s right.
